subhead: The peace plan authorizes an international force that will help secure border areas and demilitarize the Gaza Strip. It also includes a path to a future Palestinian state.

title: Louvre closes gallery amid concerns over fragile beams
subhead: The Louvre said it will close the Campana Gallery while experts investigate the weakened beams supporting part of the second floor in the museum's Sully wing.

title: Xu Yangtian, the invisible self-made man behind Shein
subhead: As the Chinese ultra-fast-fashion platform faces possible suspension in France, Le Monde profiled its 41-year-old founder, who built his meteoric fortune while cultivating an aura of extreme discretion.

title: Glenn Lowry, former director of MoMA: 'We must not return to a narrow history of art'
subhead: The historian who revitalized the revered New York institution is set to lead the Louvre Chair from November 17 to December 1, delivering a series of lectures on the theme of the museum of tomorrow.

title: Sudanese refugees fleeing war find shelter under Paris bridge
subhead: In the north of the French capital, migrants have set up a makeshift camp. Many are from Darfur and fled a region torn by fighting between the Khartoum army and the Rapid Support Forces paramilitaries.

title: Euroclear, the Belgian institution managing frozen Russian assets that will 'not rule out' suing the EU
subhead: Euroclear, a little-known but central player in Europe's financial system, holds €193 billion in frozen Russian assets that, since the invasion of Ukraine, have drawn intense scrutiny. Its director general, Valérie Urbain, warns that confiscation – illegal under international law – would weaken Europe's position.
